intro: Carduus × orthocephalus nothosubsp. carniolicus, commonly known as the Carpathian thistle, is a hybrid plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and large, pale yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This nothosubspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique genetic makeup and ecological role in its native habitat.
